thread.title: Alto Cinco plans 2015 Halloween party with live music, costume contest
thread.title_full: Alto Cinco plans 2015 Halloween party with live music, costume contest | syracuse.com

author: Katrina Tulloch | ktulloch@syracuse.com
title: Alto Cinco plans 2015 Halloween party with live music, costume contest
text:
Alto Cinco's Halloween decorations in 2014. Alto Cinco | Facebook SYRACUSE, N.Y. -- For the second year in a row, Alto Cinco will celebrate Halloween by turning the restaurant into a haunted house equipped for a monstrous party at 526 Westcott St.
Last year's inaugural Halloween party drew at least 200 people.
This year, there will be live funk music by The Nasty Truth and the Hoffman Family Band, plus a midnight costume contest with prizes for wearers of the scariest, most creative and funniest costumes. DJMJ will host a dance party to finish out the night.
Come in your best costume and enjoy late night food and drink specials from the restaurant's new full liquor selection.
Following a recent expansion earlier in 2015 , Alto Cinco now presents weekly live music with rock, experimental, indie and hip hop performances starting at 11 p.m. and continuing until last call.
Other upcoming concerts at Alto Cinco:
Friday, Oct. 9: Syracuse garage rock band Papership (11:30 p.m.)
Friday, Oct. 16: Buffalo acoustic folk band The Observers
Katrina Tulloch writes features and entertainment stories for Syracuse.com and The Post-Standard. Contact her: Email | Twitter | Google+
